verses.kjv: Now it came to pass, when Adonizedec king of Jerusalem had heard how Joshua had taken Ai, and had utterly destroyed it; as he had done to Jericho and her king, so he had done to Ai and her king; and how the inhabitants of Gibeon had made peace with Israel, and were among them;
verses.web: Now when Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem heard how Joshua had taken Ai, and had utterly destroyed it; as he had done to Jericho and her king, so he had done to Ai and her king; and how the inhabitants of Gibeon had made peace with Israel, and were among them,
verses.ct: When Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem heard that Joshua had captured Ai and completely destroyed it — doing to Ai and its king exactly what he had done to Jericho and its king — and that the people of Gibeon had made a peace treaty with Israel and were now living among them,

verses.kjv: That they feared greatly, because Gibeon was a great city, as one of the royal cities, and because it was greater than Ai, and all the men thereof were mighty.
verses.web: they were very afraid, because Gibeon was a great city, as one of the royal cities, and because it was greater than Ai, and all its men were mighty.
verses.ct: he and his people were terrified. Gibeon was a large and important city, as significant as any royal city. It was bigger than Ai, and all its men were strong warriors.

verses.kjv: Wherefore Adonizedec king of Jerusalem sent unto Hoham king of Hebron, and unto Piram king of Jarmuth, and unto Japhia king of Lachish, and unto Debir king of Eglon, saying,
verses.web: Therefore Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem sent to Hoham king of Hebron, Piram king of Jarmuth, Japhia king of Lachish, and Debir king of Eglon, saying,
verses.ct: So Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem sent an urgent message to Hoham king of Hebron, Piram king of Jarmuth, Japhia king of Lachish, and Debir king of Eglon:

verses.kjv: Come up unto me, and help me, that we may smite Gibeon: for it hath made peace with Joshua and with the children of Israel.
verses.web: “Come up to me and help me. Let’s strike Gibeon; for they have made peace with Joshua and with the children of Israel.”
verses.ct: "Come join forces with me so we can attack Gibeon, because they've made peace with Joshua and the people of Israel."

verses.kjv: Therefore the five kings of the Amorites, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, the king of Eglon, gathered themselves together, and went up, they and all their hosts, and encamped before Gibeon, and made war against it.
verses.web: Therefore the five kings of the Amorites, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon, gathered themselves together and went up, they and all their armies, and encamped against Gibeon, and made war against it.
verses.ct: These 5 Amorite kings — the kings of Jerusalem, Hebron, Jarmuth, Lachish, and Eglon — assembled their armies, marched to Gibeon, surrounded it, and launched their attack.

verses.kjv: And the men of Gibeon sent unto Joshua to the camp to Gilgal, saying, Slack not thy hand from thy servants; come up to us quickly, and save us, and help us: for all the kings of the Amorites that dwell in the mountains are gathered together against us.
verses.web: The men of Gibeon sent to Joshua at the camp at Gilgal, saying, “Don’t abandon your servants! Come up to us quickly and save us! Help us; for all the kings of the Amorites that dwell in the hill country have gathered together against us.”
verses.ct: The men of Gibeon sent an urgent message to Joshua at the camp in Gilgal: "Don't abandon us! Come quickly and rescue us! Every Amorite king in the hill country has joined forces against us!"

verses.kjv: So Joshua ascended from Gilgal, he, and all the people of war with him, and all the mighty men of valour.
verses.web: So Joshua went up from Gilgal, he, and the whole army with him, including all the mighty men of valor.
verses.ct: Joshua mobilized immediately, marching out of Gilgal with his entire army, including all his best fighting men.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Joshua, Fear them not: for I have delivered them into thine hand; there shall not a man of them stand before thee.
verses.web: LORD said to Joshua, “Don’t fear them, for I have delivered them into your hands. Not a man of them will stand before you.”
verses.ct: The LORD told Joshua, "Don't be afraid of them. I've already handed them over to you. Not one of them will be able to stand against you."

verses.kjv: Joshua therefore came unto them suddenly, and went up from Gilgal all night.
verses.web: Joshua therefore came to them suddenly. He marched from Gilgal all night.
verses.ct: Joshua marched all night from Gilgal and caught them completely off guard.

verses.kjv: And the LORD discomfited them before Israel, and slew them with a great slaughter at Gibeon, and chased them along the way that goeth up to Bethhoron, and smote them to Azekah, and unto Makkedah.
verses.web: LORD confused them before Israel. He killed them with a great slaughter at Gibeon, and chased them by the way of the ascent of Beth Horon, and struck them to Azekah and to Makkedah.
verses.ct: The LORD threw the enemy into chaos as Israel attacked. Joshua's forces slaughtered them in huge numbers at Gibeon, then chased the survivors up the road to Beth-horon, cutting them down all the way to Azekah and Makkedah.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as they fled from before Israel, and were in the going down to Bethhoron, that the LORD cast down great stones from heaven upon them unto Azekah, and they died: they were more which died with hailstones than they whom the children of Israel slew with the sword.
verses.web: As they fled from before Israel, while they were at the descent of Beth Horon, LORD hurled down great stones from the sky on them to Azekah, and they died. There were more who died from the hailstones than those whom the children of Israel killed with the sword.
verses.ct: As the enemy fled down the pass from Beth-horon, the LORD hurled massive hailstones from the sky on them all the way to Azekah. More soldiers died from the hailstones than from the swords of Israel.

verses.kjv: Then spake Joshua to the LORD in the day when the LORD delivered up the Amorites before the children of Israel, and he said in the sight of Israel, Sun, stand thou still upon Gibeon; and thou, Moon, in the valley of Ajalon.
verses.web: Then Joshua spoke to LORD in the day when LORD delivered up the Amorites before the children of Israel. He said in the sight of Israel, “Sun, stand still on Gibeon! You, moon, stop in the valley of Aijalon!”
verses.ct: On that day, when the LORD was handing the Amorites over to Israel, Joshua spoke to the LORD. Then, in front of all Israel, he called out, "Sun, stand still over Gibeon! Moon, stop over the valley of Aijalon!"

verses.kjv: And the sun stood still, and the moon stayed, until the people had avenged themselves upon their enemies. Is not this written in the book of Jasher? So the sun stood still in the midst of heaven, and hasted not to go down about a whole day.
verses.web: The sun stood still, and the moon stayed, until the nation had avenged themselves of their enemies. Isn’t this written in the book of Jashar? The sun stayed in the middle of the sky, and didn’t hurry to go down about a whole day.
verses.ct: The sun stood still and the moon stopped moving until the nation had finished defeating its enemies. This is recorded in the book of Jasher. The sun stayed in the middle of the sky and didn't set for an entire day.

verses.kjv: And there was no day like that before it or after it, that the LORD hearkened unto the voice of a man: for the LORD fought for Israel.
verses.web: There was no day like that before it or after it, that LORD listened to the voice of a man; for LORD fought for Israel.
verses.ct: There has never been a day like it before or since — a day when the LORD responded to a man's command. The LORD himself was fighting for Israel.

verses.kjv: And Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, unto the camp to Gilgal.
verses.web: Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, to the camp to Gilgal.
verses.ct: Then Joshua and all Israel returned to the camp at Gilgal.

verses.kjv: But these five kings fled, and hid themselves in a cave at Makkedah.
verses.web: These five kings fled, and hid themselves in the cave at Makkedah.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, the 5 kings had escaped and hidden themselves in a cave at Makkedah.

verses.kjv: And it was told Joshua, saying, The five kings are found hid in a cave at Makkedah.
verses.web: Joshua was told, saying, “The five kings have been found, hidden in the cave at Makkedah.”
verses.ct: When Joshua received word that the 5 kings had been found hiding in the cave at Makkedah,

verses.kjv: And Joshua said, Roll great stones upon the mouth of the cave, and set men by it for to keep them:
verses.web: Joshua said, “Roll large stones to cover the cave’s entrance, and set men by it to guard them;
verses.ct: he ordered, "Roll large stones over the mouth of the cave and post guards there.

verses.kjv: And stay ye not, but pursue after your enemies, and smite the hindmost of them; suffer them not to enter into their cities: for the LORD your God hath delivered them into your hand.
verses.web: but don’t stay there. Pursue your enemies, and attack them from the rear. Don’t allow them to enter into their cities; for LORD your God has delivered them into your hand.”
verses.ct: But don't stop to deal with them now! Keep chasing the enemy and attack them from behind. Don't let them reach their cities, because the LORD your God has given them to you."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Joshua and the children of Israel had made an end of slaying them with a very great slaughter, till they were consumed, that the rest which remained of them entered into fenced cities.
verses.web: When Joshua and the children of Israel had finished killing them with a very great slaughter until they were consumed, and the remnant which remained of them had entered into the fortified cities,
verses.ct: Joshua and the Israelites inflicted a devastating defeat on the enemy, nearly wiping them out completely. The few survivors managed to escape into their fortified cities.

verses.kjv: And all the people returned to the camp to Joshua at Makkedah in peace: none moved his tongue against any of the children of Israel.
verses.web: all the people returned to the camp to Joshua at Makkedah in peace. None moved his tongue against any of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: The entire army then returned safely to Joshua at the camp in Makkedah. No one dared to say a word against the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: Then said Joshua, Open the mouth of the cave, and bring out those five kings unto me out of the cave.
verses.web: Then Joshua said, “Open the cave entrance, and bring those five kings out of the cave to me.”
verses.ct: Then Joshua said, "Open the cave and bring those 5 kings out to me."

verses.kjv: And they did so, and brought forth those five kings unto him out of the cave, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon.
verses.web: They did so, and brought those five kings out of the cave to him: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon.
verses.ct: His men did so, dragging out the 5 kings: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when they brought out those kings unto Joshua, that Joshua called for all the men of Israel, and said unto the captains of the men of war which went with him, Come near, put your feet upon the necks of these kings. And they came near, and put their feet upon the necks of them.
verses.web: When they brought those kings out to Joshua, Joshua called for all the men of Israel, and said to the chiefs of the men of war who went with him, “Come near. Put your feet on the necks of these kings.” They came near, and put their feet on their necks.
verses.ct: Once the kings were brought before him, Joshua summoned all the men of Israel and told the army commanders who had fought with him, "Come here and put your feet on the necks of these kings." They stepped forward and placed their feet on the kings' necks.

verses.kjv: And Joshua said unto them, Fear not, nor be dismayed, be strong and of good courage: for thus shall the LORD do to all your enemies against whom ye fight.
verses.web: Joshua said to them, “Don’t be afraid, nor be dismayed. Be strong and courageous, for LORD will do this to all your enemies against whom you fight.”
verses.ct: Joshua told them, "Don't be afraid or discouraged. Be strong and courageous, because this is what the LORD will do to every enemy you face."

verses.kjv: And afterward Joshua smote them, and slew them, and hanged them on five trees: and they were hanging upon the trees until the evening.
verses.web: Afterward Joshua struck them, put them to death, and hanged them on five trees. They were hanging on the trees until the evening.
verses.ct: After that, Joshua struck down the 5 kings, killed them, and hung their bodies on 5 trees, where they remained until evening.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the time of the going down of the sun, that Joshua commanded, and they took them down off the trees, and cast them into the cave wherein they had been hid, and laid great stones in the cave’s mouth, which remain until this very day.
verses.web: At the time of the going down of the sun, Joshua commanded, and they took them down off the trees, and threw them into the cave in which they had hidden themselves, and laid great stones on the mouth of the cave, which remain to this very day.
verses.ct: At sunset, Joshua ordered the bodies taken down from the trees and thrown into the cave where the kings had hidden. Large stones were placed over the cave's entrance, and they are still there to this day.

verses.kjv: And that day Joshua took Makkedah, and smote it with the edge of the sword, and the king thereof he utterly destroyed, them, and all the souls that were therein; he let none remain: and he did to the king of Makkedah as he did unto the king of Jericho.
verses.web: Joshua took Makkedah on that day, and struck it with the edge of the sword, with its king. He utterly destroyed it and all the souls who were in it. He left no one remaining. He did to the king of Makkedah as he had done to the king of Jericho.
verses.ct: That same day, Joshua captured Makkedah and put everyone in it to the sword, including its king. He completely destroyed every person there, leaving no survivors. He treated the king of Makkedah the same way he had treated the king of Jericho.

verses.kjv: Then Joshua passed from Makkedah, and all Israel with him, unto Libnah, and fought against Libnah:
verses.web: Joshua passed from Makkedah, and all Israel with him, to Libnah, and fought against Libnah.
verses.ct: From Makkedah, Joshua and all Israel moved on to Libnah and attacked it.

verses.kjv: And the LORD delivered it also, and the king thereof, into the hand of Israel; and he smote it with the edge of the sword, and all the souls that were therein; he let none remain in it; but did unto the king thereof as he did unto the king of Jericho.
verses.web: LORD delivered it also, with its king, into the hand of Israel. He struck it with the edge of the sword, and all the souls who were in it. He left no one remaining in it. He did to its king as he had done to the king of Jericho.
verses.ct: The LORD handed Libnah and its king over to Israel. Joshua put everyone in the city to the sword, leaving no survivors. He did to its king what he had done to the king of Jericho.

verses.kjv: And Joshua passed from Libnah, and all Israel with him, unto Lachish, and encamped against it, and fought against it:
verses.web: Joshua passed from Libnah, and all Israel with him, to Lachish, and encamped against it, and fought against it.
verses.ct: From Libnah, Joshua and all Israel advanced to Lachish, set up camp around it, and attacked.

verses.kjv: And the LORD delivered Lachish into the hand of Israel, which took it on the second day, and smote it with the edge of the sword, and all the souls that were therein, according to all that he had done to Libnah.
verses.web: LORD delivered Lachish into the hand of Israel. He took it on the second day, and struck it with the edge of the sword, with all the souls who were in it, according to all that he had done to Libnah.
verses.ct: The LORD gave Lachish to Israel. Joshua captured it on the 2nd day and put everyone in it to the sword, just as he had done to Libnah.

verses.kjv: Then Horam king of Gezer came up to help Lachish; and Joshua smote him and his people, until he had left him none remaining.
verses.web: Then Horam king of Gezer came up to help Lachish; and Joshua struck him and his people, until he had left him no one remaining.
verses.ct: King Horam of Gezer came to help defend Lachish, but Joshua defeated him and his army, leaving no survivors.

verses.kjv: And from Lachish Joshua passed unto Eglon, and all Israel with him; and they encamped against it, and fought against it:
verses.web: Joshua passed from Lachish, and all Israel with him, to Eglon; and they encamped against it and fought against it.
verses.ct: From Lachish, Joshua and all Israel moved on to Eglon. They surrounded it and attacked.

verses.kjv: And they took it on that day, and smote it with the edge of the sword, and all the souls that were therein he utterly destroyed that day, according to all that he had done to Lachish.
verses.web: They took it on that day, and struck it with the edge of the sword. He utterly destroyed all the souls who were in it that day, according to all that he had done to Lachish.
verses.ct: They captured it that same day and put everyone to the sword, completely destroying every person in it, just as he had done to Lachish.

verses.kjv: And Joshua went up from Eglon, and all Israel with him, unto Hebron; and they fought against it:
verses.web: Joshua went up from Eglon, and all Israel with him, to Hebron; and they fought against it.
verses.ct: From Eglon, Joshua and all Israel marched up to Hebron and attacked it.

verses.kjv: And they took it, and smote it with the edge of the sword, and the king thereof, and all the cities thereof, and all the souls that were therein; he left none remaining, according to all that he had done to Eglon; but destroyed it utterly, and all the souls that were therein.
verses.web: They took it, and struck it with the edge of the sword, with its king and all its cities, and all the souls who were in it. He left no one remaining, according to all that he had done to Eglon; but he utterly destroyed it, and all the souls who were in it.
verses.ct: They captured the city, its king, and all its surrounding towns, putting everyone to the sword. Joshua left no survivors, just as he had done to Eglon. He completely destroyed the city and every person in it.

verses.kjv: And Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, to Debir; and fought against it:
verses.web: Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, to Debir, and fought against it.
verses.ct: Then Joshua and all Israel turned toward Debir and attacked it.

verses.kjv: And he took it, and the king thereof, and all the cities thereof; and they smote them with the edge of the sword, and utterly destroyed all the souls that were therein; he left none remaining: as he had done to Hebron, so he did to Debir, and to the king thereof; as he had done also to Libnah, and to her king.
verses.web: He took it, with its king and all its cities. They struck them with the edge of the sword, and utterly destroyed all the souls who were in it. He left no one remaining. As he had done to Hebron, so he did to Debir, and to its king; as he had done also to Libnah, and to its king.
verses.ct: He captured it along with its king and all its surrounding towns. They put everyone to the sword, completely destroying every person there with no survivors. He did to Debir and its king what he had done to Hebron, and what he had done to Libnah and its king.

verses.kjv: So Joshua smote all the country of the hills, and of the south, and of the vale, and of the springs, and all their kings: he left none remaining, but utterly destroyed all that breathed, as the LORD God of Israel commanded.
verses.web: So Joshua struck all the land, the hill country, the South, the lowland, the slopes, and all their kings. He left no one remaining, but he utterly destroyed all that breathed, as LORD, the God of Israel, commanded.
verses.ct: Joshua conquered the entire region — the hill country, the southern desert, the western foothills, and the mountain slopes — along with all their kings. He left no survivors, completely destroying everything that breathed, just as the LORD God of Israel had commanded.

verses.kjv: And Joshua smote them from Kadeshbarnea even unto Gaza, and all the country of Goshen, even unto Gibeon.
verses.web: Joshua struck them from Kadesh Barnea even to Gaza, and all the country of Goshen, even to Gibeon.
verses.ct: Joshua's conquests stretched from Kadesh-barnea all the way to Gaza, and across the entire region of Goshen up to Gibeon.

verses.kjv: And all these kings and their land did Joshua take at one time, because the LORD God of Israel fought for Israel.
verses.web: Joshua took all these kings and their land at one time because LORD, the God of Israel, fought for Israel.
verses.ct: Joshua captured all these kings and their territory in a single campaign, because the LORD God of Israel was fighting for Israel.

verses.kjv: And Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, unto the camp to Gilgal.
verses.web: Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, to the camp to Gilgal.
verses.ct: Then Joshua and all Israel returned to the camp at Gilgal.
